definition: ordained or appointed to a post/to benefit from counsel
to receive/to accept/to suffer/subjected to/to bear/to stand/pleasant/(passive marker)
life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc
to become Emperor by the grace of Heaven/to "receive the Mandate of Heaven" (traditional English translation)
(idiom) to take on a leadership role at a time of crisis

sentences.english: As the enemy retreated, we were ordered to disengage.
sentences.chinese: 當敵人退卻時我們受命撤出戰鬥。

sentences.english: The less time you spend sitting, the longer your lifespan.
sentences.chinese: 你坐着的時間越短，你的受命則會越長。

sentences.english: The programmer writes one mnemonic (memory-aiding) instruction for each machine-level instruction.
sentences.chinese: 接受命令並將該命令解釋爲機器指令的程序。

sentences.english: The reader or smart card is not ready to accept commands.
sentences.chinese: 讀取器或智能卡尚未準備好接受命令。

sentences.english: Then he still didn't obey king's order and killed himself with a sword .
sentences.chinese: 於是他仍不接受命令，用劍自殺而死。

sentences.english: Paris was tasked with choosing who the most beautiful was.
sentences.chinese: 帕里斯受命決定誰是最漂亮的女人。

sentences.english: "We did not get instructions to shoot at anything that moved, " said one soldier.
sentences.chinese: “我們沒有受命向所有移動目標開槍，”一名士兵說。

sentences.english: He was given the task of painting a picture of St Matthew for the alter of a church in Rome.
sentences.chinese: 當時他受命給羅馬一座教堂的祭壇畫一幅聖馬太的像。

sentences.english: Prime Minister Guillaume Soro has been asked to form a new government.
sentences.chinese: 總理紀堯姆縈羅已經受命去組織新的政府。

sentences.english: Junkers were ordered northwards to help a German merchantman which were under attack by a Norwegian destroyer.
sentences.chinese: 容受命飛助正遭受挪威驅逐艦襲擊德運輸船。

sentences.english: And I also don't like taking orders.
sentences.chinese: 而且我不喜歡接受命令。

sentences.english: Our gun crew was then ordered to destroy this enemy battery.
sentences.chinese: 我們炮兵其後受命殲滅敵人的炮兵連。

sentences.english: The Sixth Fleet of the United States Navy was ordered to the South Sea.
sentences.chinese: 美國海軍第六艦隊受命駛向南海。

sentences.english: Large field belongs to the Japanese Army 43 Division was ordered to hang on the island.
sentences.chinese: 大場所屬的日本陸軍43師團受命死守這個小島。

sentences.english: Dr. Smith is assigned to take charge of the department.
sentences.chinese: 史密斯大夫受命分管這個部門。

sentences.english: All of us were sent to Washington to carry out the people's business.
sentences.chinese: 我們在座的各位受命來到華盛頓都是要爲民服務。

definition: to receive orders/to follow orders/to act under orders
appointment (to a job)/to be appointed (to high office)/to accept an appointment/entrusted with responsibilities/same as 授任
to put down a revolt/to pacify a rebellion
to offer (tribute)/to present respectfully (to superior, ancestor, deity etc)/to esteem/to revere/to believe in (a religion)/to wait upon/to accept orders (from superior)
to go abroad as ambassador/to be sent on a diplomatic mission
